IE7oOzBNqdFu8SGzwxJLfA.text: Took 10 minutes to get a sandwich. Corned beef sandwich was supposed to be hot. It was cold. Asked for a bagel to not be toasted. They toasted it. Corned beef was dry, might have been frozen. Never going back.

7Apk7DYYCoOhFpNNGLjJeQ.text: Bagel Factory is one of those places I hadn't stopped at in awhile, so after a morning of strolling and shopping in the neighborhood, I thought I'd have a revisit.  Truth be told, Ruggeri's is actually my favorite place now in Squirrel Hill for a sandwich.  But since I'm off work all week, I figured I could stop there on another day.  I was in the mood for a good sandwich though and I thought I'd try "Reuben's Sister Rachel".  A Rachel is basically corned beef on deli rye with kraut, swiss, and Russian dressing.  My sandwich was a good, nuthin' fancy, basic, solid fare.    Bagel Factory is okay in my book and I've got to admit theirs are w-a-y better than Bruegger's!  But the carbs, the carbs!

OFt2NNaToK-MJXFOjhU3tA.text: We drove around Squirrel Hill looking for a place to get breakfast since Pamela's was packed and we were short on time, so The Bagel Factory seemed to fit the bill. Unfortunately, the visit left me wishing I had just went back to Einstein's.   When we approached the counter we weren't really greeted...the girl just waited for us to say something. I got the bacon egg and cheese on sesame, husband got a BLT on white. We waited what seemed like a long while in bagel-sandwich-time before we got our plates. My husband said the bread on his sandwich was quite underwhelming. My entire sandwich had basically no taste at all. The bagel was dry and had a burny taste. The egg, cheddar, and even the bacon had absolutely on flavor at all. I thought a bacon egg and cheese sandwich was one of those things that's pretty hard to ruin, and the Bagel Factory managed to do so. I was pretty disappointed and eded up heading to Paddy Cake Bakery for a nice glazed donut to restore the moisture in my mouth.

tNOv6Mrp-U0vxYp45wj9Ig.text: I'm not sure who voted their French Toast the best in Pgh but it wasn't me. It was their special today and I found it absolutely tasteless. My friend found their coffee to be just "okay." Their bagels and bacon were delicious though. I bought a second groupon to try their lunch menu at a later date. So obviously it's worth the trip. I just wouldn't recommend the French Toast

ceuulT1_wd8gOPBFICwCvw.text: 3.5, but more of a 3 than a 4 so I'll round down.  Thanks to Groupon, I was well fed for the rest of the day for only $8.  - Smoked Turkey w/ Egg and Cheese on a toasted Honey Oat Bagel: WIN!!! - Ham w/ Egg and Cheese on a toasted Whole Wheat Bagel: LOSE (ham was too salty) - Chicken Salad on Whole Wheat: LOSE (too much sodium) - Coffee: Not a win, not a lose either  I'll be back to try some of the other items on the menu (and to use up my other Groupon offers).   As far as the service goes, I didn't have any issues with the workers there. They weren't overly friendly, but they weren't unfriendly either.

g0y7_jViDRgeN8hldHIhtA.text: As somewhat of a reply to another review, you walk in and get in line.  When you get to the counter, you tell them what you want, and they give you a check, which you take to the register.  You get drinks at the register and pay, while the person who took your order makes your food and then brings it out to you.  Service is always good.  I've been in here many times for breakfast, for lunch, and five minutes before they close, and five to ten minutes is pretty typical; longer than that is very atypical, in my experience.  If they have a lot of take-out orders, the place can be very busy without many people sitting down.  That said, the bagels are outstanding, as is the rest of the food; they serve full breakfast fare and sandwiches; it's a full deli.  The food here is wonderful, and it's a place I take out of town visitors to and would do so again.  There's also a Ben & Jerry's ice cream in the same space; they hire only disadvantages/at-risk kids, and it works out pretty darn well.

sli1tFx1q3-fVTGoQY1pTw.text: Fabulous bagels.  We stopped with a friend in Pittsburgh on our way across the country, and she took us here to grab bagels for the road.  We grabbed a baker's dozen of assorted bagels and some house-made cream cheese. The garlic herb creme cheese is *awesome* (filled with chunks of garlic).    The bagels were quite tasty: substantial, chewy, and delicious. The veggie bagel was particularly memorable.  Service was good and low-key.  Recommended.

9LD3g8q92thOy7WemwoTxQ.text: For the longest time I didn't care for this place but ate there often because it was near work. The bagels are good but kinda expensive, the deli sandwiches are lack luster, the salads were typically browning and the service was disgruntled. I no longer work near the bagel factory and revisited it today. The service was still grumpy but my  egg cheese bacon bagel sandwich was awesome. It was deserving of me writing a review. This sandwich is available at gas stations but finally the bagel factory showed me why i didn't go to sheetz in the first place.To me this is a two star spot, but maybe this is a sign of turning a corner.

qwumDQ1xYmvYTMy_yHDyLg.text: Our regular bagel joint. The bagels are fresh, and made on site. Nice. The recipe might take some getting used to, however. The bagels (and I mean even the poppy, the garlic, the everything) are slightly sweet. How odd.   I also had a great whitefish salad bagel here, and a delicious, old-fashioned tuna melt. I like the food here better than the Smallman Street Deli; I don't know, the same things feel kind of carelessly made over there.   And the service (while not great - I saw the woman behind the counter lose patience with an elderly man who was hard of hearing) is actually much, much better than Smallman Street.

Bg1O1XMlH93ur-CgwcMg3Q.text: Good Food.  Prices are high.  Service is not that great and it gets very busy on the weekend.

-cX6V2-jsDtLWHFqwMTUuw.text: The bagels are on the tough and chewy side, and the orange juice (which for some reason I though would be fresh) tasted like Minute Maid. If that sounds like your idea of good food, go for it! Seriously, this place is okay, but it's nothing special - decent enough food, but nothing amazing.

7TGULVtD7GxZ0KrbGsl2ng.text: TERRIBLE service.  The woman at the cash register YELLED at me for using a coupon.  I would never go back there.

VBLt98bl0-0SDDkQSITZEA.text: Stopped in prior to house hunting at Coldwell Banker.  Enjoyed a delicious Lox Scramble and blueberry bagel.  The hubs got  the Challah French Toast.  He was not a huge fan, but what does he know (I'm really the FT guru in this house).  I can see this place has the potential to get packed on a weekend morning, but on the plus side, you can buy your baked goods to bring home.  Dine-in service was average. (There's even a deal on Groupon right now)

ewzjWwZkHRLHJtdOClTjEA.text: Just stopped in this morning and go two bagels to go.  One everything with garlic & herb cream cheese, and a "super" cinnamon w/ walnut and raisin cream cheese.  The cream cheese on these suckers were amazing, a huge difference between store bought.  The bagel on the other hand was good - not great, so three stars it is.  I paid around $5 for the two bagels, so they weren't cheap either.  All and all a solid bagel place.

UxYdT7Ft4QxwSog7qxVtEQ.text: Best bagels in Pittsburgh- IF you get them fresh!...Wait until the end of the day and they are rock solid.   Unfortunately, service here is terrible. A glacier moves faster than the line at Bagel Factory and the system is incredibly inefficient. Go to Brueggers down the street if you're in a rush. And don't bother asking if they'll slice your bagels- the won't do it- even if you're the only  customer in the store and are willing to pay extra. The cashier (an older/middle-aged woman) seems to be in a permanent bad mood and gets mad if you ask for an itemized recipt (I needed it for work).

wURsesi7HZFaGZZN4kx5ig.text: The salt bagel has replaced the everything bagel as my breakfast carb of choice.  Just thought you all should know!

u-Gx_AQ9XrIWqruvrlTHGg.text: I have very few positive remarks about this restaurant.  I have been there twice but have only eaten once.  The first time I stopped here, I waited upwards of 12 minutes for two breakfast sandwiches to go.  The food was decent, maybe a step above Dunkin Donuts but definitely not two steps.  I thought maybe it was a fluke and stopped in again today.  I pulled the Irish walkout after waiting for more than five minutes without even ordering.  And there was only 2 people in front of me, none of whom had been lucky enough to even order.  Sensing another long wait for mediocre food, I took my business elsewhere.  Understaffed,overpriced.  Are these really the best bagels in Pittsburgh? The only positive is that there is an enjoining Ben and Jerry's Scoop Shop.

rt7ejsE5ySL7jX8TaGk01g.text: Ordered the nova lox on a sesame bagel. The bagel was really sweet-- gross! You'd think a place that has a ton of sandwich options would make sure their plain-ish bagel flavors would actually taste like bread and not sugar... Sweetness aside, the bagel itself was a little hard.

uSC0Ft1aUYIvI-0dKrJ6FQ.text: Way overpriced for the product.  The smallest amount of pastrami I've ever seen on a sandwich.  Enough said.

BBli1hfxqacgJMpIo23RHQ.text: The food is always excellent.  The staff usually are usually stressed out; I guess I'd be the same if I had a line of people waiting to order that was 10 people deep!!  They can get a bit pickey with small things that are not enough to stop me from going there but they do make me think twice before I get a dozen bagels to take home: such as:  not being willing to slice your bagels that you bought to take home.  I'm not sure why they don't just have one of those automatic machines that you put the bagel in and it slices it for you.    Overall the food is great and if the place isn't packed the staff are much more apt to smile.

Rvn_aQNiC5vAh4EPXSv-pA.text: I love the food here.  And it is super convenient.  Those are 4 stars.  But the service is just painful.  Slow.  Uninspired.  Bothersome.  The sense it get is that I am interrupting them by actually wanting to spend money.  I would be a weekly customer if this weren't so.  As is I come maybe twice a year.

K5j01imCaLrJlsGjqgdJDA.text: Trully the best bagels in the 'burgh, made on premises.  Tried the Nova Lox , was a great bagel sandwich and the tuna salad was nice as well.  Little expensive for what is being offered but  worth it.

ib12OFa0aKe4Q8BwqXfYGA.text: Great selection. Quickly served. They forgot about one of our orders and we had to wait a decent time to get it. Staff was pretty friendly though. Cream cheeses were great. Be aware, they butter all the bagels before they put the other toppings on so if your a health but ask for NO butter. Cute little shop though.

uoPlDr-LrX6zW_JwGxOutg.text: Got an omelette it was good a little too Salty for my liking, but I enjoyed it enough. The service on the other hand was appalling on how rude they were I had a few questions and the lady seemed so annoyed and then they forgot my potatoes and again were very rude about it. Probably won't go back

wdmegyAe4lmGwZx0BliQBA.text: I've been here twice and both times have been utterly disappointed.  Are the bagels good?  Yes.  So what?  Other places have good bagels too.  The service here is always incredibly slow.  The prices are absurd.  $1.50 upcharge to add peanut butter to a bagel.  Really?  I won't even go on any further. (It might not be $1.50 exactly, but it's not too far from that)  Also, label your bagel chip bags.  No one likes a guessing game trying to find a bag of plain bagel chips.

U99mv8GbY0aLfVUA9ZDpsg.text: The bagels here are good and the price is about right. I prefer to go to bagel shops like this opposed to the national chains. I usually order the nova lox and they are generous with the amount of smoked salmon. However, the bagel is slightly smaller than the average bagel elsewhere.   The ambiance in this place is not great. The owner apparently leased more space than he could handle (or he was too cheap) so he decided to sub lease the other half to a Ben & Jerry's. Do I care??? No, not really but this is tacky at best. Fortunately, I come here just for the bagels.

wFwXKS-y0dsPFl16X8KZ6Q.text: Veryyy overpriced for a mediocre, glorified bagel place. But I guess you're paying extra for that slow, unfriendly service, and spotty wi-fi you're never gonna connect to. Avoid!

g8BPyDq4G_Q4o1VhvWqUGw.text: I love everything about this place and it all comes down to the employees. I always get the matza ball soup and the tuna salad. The food is very consistent because the employees make it perfectly. It is perfect every time I go to this bagel factory location. They really take care of their customers. Thank you!

n6-T6_nUICyJYl07Nlsdww.text: Despite the fact that I eat here frequently-purely because of convenience and lack of a better option-the bagels are mediocre, the service is slow, and the coffee is the worst you've ever tasted. Squirrel Hill, we can do better!

P1CObACkTIn1idrKsIIwAQ.text: Was my first time there and got very little help and all the employees were extremely rude! Even after telling the cashier it was my first time she rolled her eyes. Got the BLT with turkey- felt extremely sick a few hours after eating it. NEVER going back.

SMIlJgvEI5lOWCB5UVWdJg.text: The bagels tasted fine, however there was a piece of metal in my bagel! About a half inch long and eighth inch wide piece of twisted metal that I almost swallowed and had to pull out of mouth after it cut my mouth. When we called we were told the metal was from cleaning out a machine and has happened before. They were perfectly polite, but not really concerned that it is not safe to eat metal. The challah bread we bought that same day was also extremely stale. I worked in a bakery for years and that bread had to be well over 5 days old. It was honestly the stalest bread I have ever seen in my life.

KGSkCG5SsdqQiYyMRcWBRQ.text: On the other end of my old review of the pigs, this skinny kid working here is HOTHOTHOT...g'damn! Smear that syrup on me please.

MzEqCAVLPb_7u0QhRe0g9Q.text: If I am craving a good everything bagel with bacon egg and cheese this is the the place to go.  Unlike Panera, they serve breakfast sandwiches all day long.  I have also tried their salads.  Their Pittsburgh salad is Gigantic!  It easily could be a meal for two.  All this talk of bagels is making me hungry for lunch! :-)

c95UgY4sorkpH8Gn9eHaIw.text: Decent food, but the service is way crappy. This is not based on a one-off experience, either - I go here probably once or twice a week every week, because it's close to my apartment and they have ***green tea ginger ale** (which is the coolest thing ever and I've never seen it anywhere else... ever).  When I say bad service, I mean that every employee here (with the exception of the long-haired lady behind the counter, who is pretty cool) appears to hate their job. They're surly, dismissive, scowly, or just ignore you when you're trying to place an order. I've spent ten minutes waiting to order at the counter while a guy was lounging only a couple of feet away. Got his attention, he said "oh, yeah, wait a second" and continued lounging. Super awkward.  The bagels are pretty good and come in wide variety, though. They also have a coffee machine that does a lot of specialty drinks. If they improve the dismal, horrible service I'd love to come here more often.

qmYo9lz1kKzo-v3rqoYPfg.text: Worst place in Sq.Hill. The only reason I went there couple times is because it's right across from my work. People are rude, takes forever to get your food. Today i went there at 7:30 am and lady who takes orders was actually sleeping behind the counter. I place an order and went to pay. I had gift card and after gift card my balance was $1.06. Lady at the register start refusing to take my debit card and keep telling me it takes them 60 cents just to run my card. After I told her I will just leave my $25 order that I just place and walk away she finally took my card and asked me don't come here if I don't have cash. Well, I wasn't planning to come back anyway

ALJM3eZTdmTjiGDRmcMBiA.text: Good selection of deli foods. My sister and I stopped in during Passover so we picked up some chocolate covered macaroons (which didn't make it to the dinner...)  I was pretty disappointed with the lox spread. Mostly cream cheese and  maybe two lox pieces of shredded fish (much smaller than chunks). Seriously skimping on the lox. Other than the non-existent lox in the spread, the food in the display case looked very tasty.

Uqw_H2grwrVnuxfOPpiEmw.text: Bagels!!!!  Delicious Bagels!!  The Bagel Factory is one of my favorite nom-related establishments in my neighborhood.  We don't get bagels from there often (we have to walk a whoooole block and a half to get there....we're lazy) but I suspect as summer approaches and warm weather inspires me to walk around the neighborhood, it'll happen.    Their bagels are so delightful.  Fresh, delicious smelling and tasting, and they know how to properly season an everything bagel.  Those bagels should not just be everything, but EVERYWHERE.  I would like my poppy seeds, onion, and sesame seeds on the top AND the bottom of said bagel.  Otherwise one half is amazing and one half is essentially plain.  Bagel Factory understands this.  So I went there for breakfast for the first time about a week ago, and ordered matzah brie, for fun.  I make it myself, but I thought I'd try their version.  So I order it, and the dude behind the counter is like "and what kind of bagel would you like?"  and I'm all "Does not compute...." and he's like "it comes with a bagel."    ......  Matzah comes with a bagel?  Carbs + carbs = breakfast?  Okay!  So I got an everything bagel with cream cheese, and fried matzah (which had yummy onions in it).  A really weird breakfast, and I was sort of craving like...fruit or something....but all the components were delicious.  Oh and I had a chai tea.  Also tasty.  Hard not to be.  I'd definitely come back here for more brunches, but I think I'd just get a bagel sandwich of some sort, to avoid the carb+carb confusion.  Also, do you know how hard it is to walk past that Ben and Jerry's counter?  Even at like, 10 am on a Sunday?  In winter?  Holy moly.  Too much tastiness in one place.  If the Bagel Factory ever implodes, we will know why.  Ice cream and perfect bagels under one roof may be too much for the structural integrity of the building to handle.

0hKIfZC7_8Xyr1ajks_Hhg.text: We declare the Bagel Factory to be the best bagels in Pittsburgh.  Our favorites are: Marble Rye, Pumpernickel, and Egg.  The Egg or Rye are often out of stock when we go in the afternoon which is can be frustrating.  Bagel Factory is also a nice venue to meet people -- especially for blind meet-ups like interviews.  There are lots of tables, both inside and outside and a parking lot in the rear.  The biggest downside can be the service.  The people are friendly, but they can be under-staffed.  If you're ordering food during a rush period, it may take a LONG time.

R5L_p2syPRy3G9C_Y9CFfg.text: I've always gone here instead of brueggers in order to support a local business. But today, when ordering a dozen bagels, I requested that they be cut since I was taking them to the office to be eaten immediately. They told me that they couldn't do it - it's their policy to only cut bagels if you call ahead. Doesn't help me much since I was already there. I said it was ok, I could wait for them to be cut. They said no, it's the policy. Can't cut bagels. At a bagel shop. I was dumbfounded. At the time, there was nobody in line and maybe 1-2 other people in the shop. There were two employees making food - one actively making a sandwich and one standing next to her. And another working the register. If they were extremely busy at the time I could understand this policy, but given the situation, I would have appreciated them to go the extra mile to provide proper service to a customer. And oh, not cutting bagels... At a bagel store... Very strange policy.

f20Xj6VCCqkEw-bFRZhm8g.text: Great food, horrible service. The bad outweighs the good. Not worth spending your cash in that dough factory. Pass

lyQ4BfjyJ9NsatMLS7ypqw.text: This will be my local go to bagel place in Pittsburgh.  Located in pleasant but crowded Squirrel Hill.  In nice weather is an easy bike ride away.  Lots of seating.  Bagels are decent, decent for Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

33tkBjUgEDpcuiOcBpsXiQ.text: I used to be a regular at this place. But over the years it has gone down hill!   First is the service. It's terrible! Not one person is friendly and welcoming. I felt that I was an I bothering them when I asked if I could order.   Second is the old and tired and dirty inside. They never clean the tables! Plus the workers don't know proper food handling. I saw the lady handle cash and then make a sandwich with her bare hands.   The microwave seems to be the main method of cooking which is nasty.   Besides having good bagels... I wonder why I just don't go to brueggers!

yHZ6UmWM4EyNabLVjfj6oQ.text: I went in for lunch today and decided to order the Challah French Toast on the menu. When i got it, it looked really good, but the taste and flavor was lacking, to say the least. It didn't taste like it had any flavor and was extremely bland. It seems like they forgot to add cinnamon and spice to the egg rinse for the bread, it tasted like nothing. I won't be coming there again. If you are in the Squirrel Hill area, there are a lot of other restaurants with better flavor that you should go to.

v8ip4paO15ng5Ki2gCLE6A.text: Egg sandwich was great as was the coffee. Clean and friendly staff. Just wish they had the egg flavored bagel. Will go back next time I'm in town.

JgSeGsnxdI4QoUtivBklJQ.text: Consistently slow as they are always understaffed they are out of ingredients often too. I am not sure if this is standard for all the locations but this one is a solid C- all the time.

wsH97JfWlTS_9fIrUvqijA.text: Extremely subpar. Bacon was super super greasy... almost wet. The bagel was undercooked. Not a fan. If you want a bagel, go elsewhere!!!

TGde5NC3yP-yK4sr_rd3GQ.text: Espresso machine broken. Wtf. And the drip coffee tastes hours old. Unacceptable.   In addition, the restaurant is a mess. Tables all mismatched, half the room unusable with the remains of a failed ice cream shop.

gtJmV_kigb_bYx-1I3_grw.text: Not the best bagel while rating world's best bagels, but pretty good for outside NYC, and definitely better than much of the west coast. Mind you, I have only experienced the bagel, and not the shop.   Prior to our short jaunt out to Fallingwater, my friend's super nice boyfriend (also our driver for the day) went out to get our breakfast while we were getting ready to go. I got a toasted garlic bagel with plain cream cheese. It hit the spot.   They don't skimp on the cream cheese, that's for sure.

aUX29pHTkezwv3517DcVhw.text: Not too thrilled with this place. They have good french toast but sometimes the flavor doesn't repeat itself. The prices are a little steep for bagels, sandwiches and eggs. We had a groupon both times when we visited. They still honored our expired one for the price I paid for it. After buying french toast and a bowl of soup my total was $10. A little expensive for soup that taste like it came out of a can.  The sandwiches are decent but that's all I'd really buy from here. maybe each location is different and has something better to offer. I personally like the oakland store better than the squirrel hill one. If you plan on eating here, i would check that one out first.

EXVj5B0UNtksfhCgaCl8Eg.text: Nothing upsets me more than seeing the owner of a restaurant belittle his employees in front of customers...this happened not once but twice when I was there two different times (the owner's name is Dave by the way).  The prices are very high. $7.99 for a BLT with turkey and nothing else, no drink or sides. $2.25 to get a bagel with cream cheese.  The place is dirty, has fruit flies around the bagels, and has horrible music playing (I never heard anything like it played in any restaurant before).  Apparently they don't have much space in the kitchen because they store the fresh baked bread (meaning bread right out of the oven) along the wall leading to the bathroom--unwrapped, just cooling on racks. Gross.  I would love to see this place reported to the health department. It is a shame, it wasn't always like this.

3z9OSY9qJlv-z6haOWxPPg.text: Their fresh bagels & breads are spectacular - so moist and flavorful.  Though the line/wait tends to be a bit long, it's worth it.  Plus - their Groupons make it easy to get the most 'bang for your buck".  Give it a try... you'll be back.

vW1G6q9qUdGYEJ_s5p4Csw.text: I went here to get a bagel with butter. When I walked in I watched the server run both her hands over her face. She then proceeded to make my bagel without gloves and pressed down on it with her entire hand. I asked why they didn't use gloves. She seemed put off and said she didn't touch it, but offered to make another one. I asked for another one to be made. This time the frustration was taken out on my bagel. The butter was slapped on, it was smashed with her hand and then dragged across the counter, leaving a blob and streak of butter in its wake. I will never eat here again.

L_cJxhUS21id7hy0kNUqBg.text: This review is from two years ago, but I think that it is relevant, being that it involves the same owner, and Bagel Factory has been there forever. It has never sat well with me that I did not write this review back then, but when cleaning out my email boxes, I came across this gem, and am sharing with you...  I purchased a Groupon for Bagel Factory since I often frequented the establishment. I mostly visited the location on Ellsworth, but also went to the one on Forbes. My biggest complaint at the time would have been the inconsistency. Sometimes I was so pleased with my bagel sandwiches, and other items, not so much. Sometimes they listened and got my to go orders right, but often they didn't.   I was able to leave a PRIVATE review about my Groupon and took the opportunity to let the establishment know about my frustration and dissatisfaction with my recent trip that I used the Groupon for, what had gone wrong that specific time, and my remarks on the establishment in general. It is frustrating to frequently get your order wrong, and I though that I should let them know. I felt that the comments on  the uncleanliness of their establishments was warranted. They are really dirty, with grime everywhere and layers of dust on everything above you. It's gross.   Here is the owner's response to my Groupon review...  "Same in each store. Your so wrong."  That was her response. Not 'I'm sorry that you had a bad experience.' Nothing other than to basically call me a liar. So I responded...  "So, my husband's egg sandwich didn't come with cheddar cheese after explaining that only mine was to have cheddar? And I didn't receive a tasteless, different type of egg sandwich at the Shadyside location days after ordering and enjoying the same thing at the Squirrel Hill location? Your business's are not dusty and unclean? Either which way, I am not surprised that this is your response to a customer who has one too many times a bad experience at your place of business and whom you have no interest and having return."  Her kind response...  "You are the perfect example of a coupon user.  Impossible to make happy.  Want everything  for nothing. We could never make you happy even if your order was 100%right.  Thanks for supporting local.  You obviously don't care about your community.  Jamie"  I'm sorry, but is now chastising Groupon users? The same service that she gets paid for and provides?? For the record, they still sell Groupons for The Bagel Factory on a regular basis. People should know how they really feel about them.   My response, "Actually, I have been frequenting your business since it first opened at it's Ellsworth location for more than a decade, off and on. I have spent hundreds upon hundreds of dollars, as I mentioned, some of your items have been great, at times. This is the first coupon I have used at your store. I don't understand your hatred towards coupon users when you are the one offering them in the first place, and I've noticed, continue to do so. Your words are beyond insulting. "Impossible to make happy"? The first breakfast sandwich (which I paid for, full price, no coupon)  I stated, was GREAT. I returned to have another one, using my Groupon, which I purchased to SUPPORT the Bagel Factory. Key word being PURCHASED. "Want everything for nothing"? Where did I complain about the price? Where did I say that I wanted more than what I asked for? My order should have been 100% right. That's not too much to ask when ordering an egg sandwich, on everything bagel without cheddar cheese. You're welcome for my constant support of  your local business'. And no, you will not continue to have my money, full price or discounted ever again. This has nothing to do with me caring about my community as you are not part of it.  Thank you for your exceptional service, beyond rude response and showing your True colors."  And the final response that she gave...  "You have major issues    More than a kid putting the wrong cheese on a bagel. I feel so bad for you.  Best of luck"  Clearly she didn't read or understand my original words. A kid did not put the wrong kind of cheese on a bagel. I STRESSED to the gentleman making the breakfast bagels that one was to have cheddar and the other NOT. The order was to go, and we got home, we discovered melted cheddar cheese on both of our egg breakfast bagel sandwiches. He was not able to remove the cheese or eat his sandwich because of it.   As a business owner myself, I would NEVER speak to my customer this way. This is personal. aggressive and so unacceptable.   Since this incident, I have never returned to any of their establishments, and never will. They have lost what was a tolerant customer, that spent a lot of money there. I have three children, and the convenience of their food and casual atmosphere was ideal.   I know that this review is lengthy and I am leaving out additional complaints about this business, but bottom line, I wouldn't recommend it for any reason.

kxEoD9Yz3rVLG1nKfnYqPA.text: I had such high hopes for Bagel Factory.  Their restaurant smelled great and had an extensive and exciting menu, as well as the eye-temptations of all the breads and salads on display.  But then you get your food and it's uninspiring.  I had a turkey sandwich and, without a doubt, could have made the identical sandwich at home and in such a way that it (a) cost half the price and (b) had bread that didn't scratch the roof of my mouth as I ate it.  I'm open to paying a lot for good sandwiches (consider something like Ann Arbor's Zingerman's, where a sandwich will cost $14); this just wasn't good.  Likewise the other sandwiches I tasted were eh.  The best thing I tasted was a latke, and that was still kind of boring.

L84_hmU4bhUM8_skW50pYg.text: I am a sucker for good Matzoh Ball soup and the Bagel Factory's Matzoh Ball soup is one of the few that remains quite consistent and does not disappoint.    The service can be slow so I suggest calling in your order well in advance or going before the lunch rush.  The last time we got The Bagel Factory, my husband seemed quite impressed with his Sky High Deli Sandwich- the hot pastrami so that was an additional bonus (he was not as much the fan as I am of this place).    P.S.  I also recommend their grilled cheese if you are eating there!

Ox6YGlhf5_qY96WRP3BLug.text: Went here on a Saturday around 1pm. We were in the mood for a Reuben. Attempted to order 2 and we were informed the they only had enough corned beef for one sandwich. Also they were out of marble rye. On top of that the cashier was rude when we showed our disappointed.  We left...

s-tuESgA3b_j29zWOgSOLg.text: This was, perhaps, the absolute worst food experience in my life.  Upon entering, there is so much going on visually that you have to get your bearings.  There was so much merchandise piled everywhere I couldn't even see the bagels.  Then this surly dwarf of a clerk, who had the personality of a can of lye, asks,"whattya want?" Now, first, let me say that there were only two other people in the place and no one came in behind me.   I mentioned that I needed more time.  After about three seconds she asked, "you ready yet?"  I gave my order which was as simple as possible...two plain bagels for here.  She asks," Do you want them toasted, sliced, cream cheese?"  I repeated myself, "Just two plain bagels for here."  She asks in a put out way, "Do you want them sliced?"  I said, "NO.  Just two bagels in a bag so that it's as simple as possible for you." Now, the bagels.  The absolute worst.  I would have been way ahead if I took the day old bagels.  These were dry, hard and impervious to mastication. If you are up to a challenge for your dental work and want to be spoken down to by an angry dwarf, then the Bagel Factory experience is for you

4XOtcRohQFUubGekJxAdTw.text: I have never had a bad experience at the Bagel Factory. I've eaten breakfast and lunch, redeemed Groupons, and gotten their specialty breads and desserts throughout the three years I've lived in Pittsburgh. It's not a New York bagel, but in my opinion it's without a doubt the best bagel in the burgh.

LRRcAz_ORmYVUN_liDebzg.text: I really like bagels.  My favorites are whole wheat bagels (untoasted) with gobs of cream cheese, fresh garden tomatoes, red onions and smoked salmon.    I've had the opportunity to eat at the Bagel Factory in Squirrel Hill many times.    Recently, I had a big catering job, and had to pre-order several dozen bagels for a morning brunch.  I called the day before, and ordered some plain, whole wheat, and a few other varieties.  When I approached the counter at 6am on Saturday for my order, the clerk smiled and gave me four large bags filled with warm bagels.    Everything was ready- all I had to do was pay, and leave.  On my way to my event I grabbed a bagel from the bag and took a bite- it was wonderfully fresh, and tasty.    The dough was soft, and each bite thereafter was equally enjoyable.  My clients also enjoyed the bagels, many commenting on how fresh they were.  Besides selling bagels, The Bagel Factory has breakfast and lunch items.  During the summer you can have breakfast outside, and watch all the people walk by on Forbes Avenue.  If you're still hungry after breakfast or lunch, grab a Ben and Jerry's cone to go!

VryQS95OxgmkoPkLohJOPw.text: My first foray into the Pittsburgh Bagel Factory was about a year ago to use one of the Groupons they run periodically.  The prices are reasonable, they accept credit cards, and the bagels are generally quite good.  While I haven't tried the entire menu I can also speak highly of their matzo ball soup and pastrami bagel sandwiches.  Although they have free Wi-Fi for customers, the tables are a little small for a full sized laptop and a couple of books - I usually work elsewhere in the neighborhood.  I only have two minor complaints about the Bagel Factory.  First, they don't have any nutrition information, which makes it a challenge to incorporate into a diet of any kind.  And second, unlike any other business I've encountered that runs Groupons, the Bagel Factory imposes a lifetime cap of three purchases (instead of resetting the cap with each new offer).  I get that Groupon isn't a very good deal for a lot of businesses and I'm happy to pay full price, but this is just annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rachel

gN2e_195ahI1lV3tAxW3rw.text: First, my bagel and lox sandwich was decent. Not the most amazing I've ever had, but definitely hit the spot. Cup of coffee was fine. What is very disappointing about this place is its interior. I want so badly for them to read this so they can make improvements! It could be something special, with way more business than I currently observe. Its empty, large, dusty, unkempt, out of date (less important). I wanted to enjoy my breakfast while I did school work, but I couldn't because their internet was broken. The customer service was meh. The bagel sandwich with lox and a cup of coffee was over 10 dollars. What disturbed me most was how incredibly dim the place was. The workers were literally in the dark! Also, above them was a terribly dusty ceiling tile frame. Right above where I assume some of the food was made. Yuck! This place has been around for a LONG time. I hope they eventually decide to invest in some updates and bring it up to snuff. It would definitely attract more business that way. This place is a Gordon Ramsey level fixer-upper. And I truly wonder if their front-of-house looks the way it does is it up to code where they do the majority of their food prep? Probably not.

gOS6rYHmD_q_zMsUGeOH8g.text: I'm very torn about Bagel Factory, as living in New York made me a bagel snob.  It's not fair to compare Bagel Factory to a NYC bagel so I won't.  But if that is what you are craving, this will not fill that void.  I think the best bagel in Pittsburgh is a fair claim to fame, but Pittsburgh has some really bad bagels.  Just a thought.  I ordered a rye bagel with bacon, egg, and cheese ($3.99).  There was a ton of good, thick bacon on the sandwich, and that was AMAZING.  Plenty of cheese and the perfect amount of egg as well.  But the bagel was pretty much flavorless.  Rye bagels should have flavor.  If this place wasn't called the bagel factory, it would be different.  But the bagel was so whatever.  The bagels are also really small for a fresh bagel.  I would definitely come back to the Bagel Factory, but I think they really should work on creating a more memorable bagel.  They accept credit cards.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rye bagel with Bacon, Egg, and American... $3.99 wo tax

5HpTlNhuxqZ-YTAbFcwU-A.text: Meeeeh, ordered a salami bagel took 30 minutes to prepare, no line and not many people. Should have taken the bagel and prepared it at home, would have taken 3-5 minutes!

7abq3nawC0rOQ8nCm52znw.text: We come here most Tuesdays to get the buy-6 get-6 free bagels deal. The bagels are good, and the price is great! They also sell salmon and meats by the half-pound for a pretty good deal. Seating outside is nice in good weather, but otherwise inside is pretty dim and the sandwich prices aren't great.

daNxLbkRcuY4sU5BshQrSg.text: Bagels are good, pretty standard in flavor, comparable to a Einstein etc.   Coffee is normal restaurant blend type coffee not a reason to come here.   Staff super friendly.   Price for what you get? Got a toasted bagel with egg and cheese. Should have taken photo, but didn't think of it till after leaving. Bottom line: Very disappointing. Barely any cheese and egg was super thin, wasn't all of an egg but probably half of an egg. $3.50. Is been far better to have just a bagel for .99 cents. Person with me had a bagel with cream cheese, 2.99. $2 for cream cheese to be spread on it for you.   I won't be back, suffice to say.

kk-JkrZRmetANnmMUFakYg.text: It's irksome that anywhere from 50-75% of their light bulbs are burned out and not replaced. Feels unkempt and like a cave. The staff out front is always nice and smiling.   I like their breakfast and their bagel chips. They do a nice job of a greasy diner style breakfast and the bagels are ok. They also have a nice outdoor seating set up on Forbes- which is not typical on the street.   The layout seems weird because they have not converted what used to be the Ben and Jerry's ice cream on the left side of the store front. It's now just a storage corral for bagel racks and supplies.  So much potential for the location, space, and neighborhood- I would love it if that decided to capitalize on what could be a really cute breakfast eatery!

ArxsyBgyw6T9jWUzqr_z8A.text: The staff sucks! They were out of almost everything we wanted to order.  The lady at the billing counter is rude. Appears like she needs to learn some manners.  The AC was not turned on and it was hot inside.  The only good thing was the smoked turkey bagel.

-bD-HOeucIAReMZAYhKk1w.text: The bagels are good. That's all you need to know. It's all about the bagels, even if the interior is just eh the food is well priced and the location is very convenient

7EUu41keVsjDxg5-k509Hw.text: Bagels are much better than Columbus Ohio and they are generous with groupons so I can load up with 4 dozen bagels. The person that waited on us was a little edgy when stating that she had to ring up our order as two separate order. It did not matter to us and hubby apologized for the extra work.  But my sense is that perhaps she was edgy because groupon users gave her a hard time.  When she saw that we were pleasant, she quickly became friendly as well.  So to those who complain about staff, remember that a smile and a thank you nearly always helps get you what you want.  I like their bagels, especially the marble rye ones.  We help them out by calling in our order the day ahead.  Even frozen for months, they are a zillion times better that what is available in Columbus.  Oh and in the past we have got their ruben's which are very good.  Just not appealing at 8AM.

Kh3qOkiIO5SGjyyuVyG03w.text: Back in September, we tried a week of 'Buy Fresh/Buy Local,' with a goal of having 75% of our meals for the week locally-sourced. I can't say it was easy or cheap, but it was a great experience that left me with a lot of lasting decisions.  One of those decisions? Buying my bagels freshly-made from the Bagel Factory instead of in a plastic bag from the grocery store.  I like the Squirrel Hill location because it's convenient to my house, and although there is metered street parking in the front, there is also a (pay) parking lot behind the building if you have to go during a busy time of day.   They have a ton of different house-made cream cheeses (the lox and chive ones are my favorites, although they have a variety of plain and sweet-flavored cream cheeses as well). The bagels are stored behind a glass partition so you can see which of their dozen-plus flavors are available when you go in. I'm partial to the cracked wheat and grain bagels, but there are blueberry, garlic, honey oat, plain, and everything bagels (to name just a few). All of them are super-fresh and filling but light.  And best of all - at the Squirrel Hill location, if you go on a Tuesday to pick up your bagels, buy six bagels and get six bagels for free!! Free bagels! You can't argue with that!   The staff is always really friendly and helpful. They helped me learn how to freeze bagels without sacrificing quality (so that I could take advantage of that six-free-bagels deal). And any time there's a sale or a special, they will tell you right away when you go in.  The only negative part of my whole Bagel Factory experience is that the stairs leading from the shop to the parking lot out back are metal, and no matter what shoes I am wearing, I sound like an elephant entering and exiting the building. Sorry, Bagel Factory employees! I wish I didn't sound like a stompasaurus every time I go in!  This shop also has a huge chalkboard menu of sandwiches (although I have  only gone for bagels, so I can't comment on the sandwiches), and they sell fresh bread loaves, cookies, and other baked goods as well.  So, be ready to say goodbye to Thomas' bagels at Giant Eagle. Once you get your fresh breakfast bagels from the Bagel Factory, you won't be able to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Heck yes! Bonus bagel day!

rBaEF1ogx4RW9A1qzvB1NQ.text: I don't know why I do it, but every time I'm in the area I decide to come back here. And sadly I'm usually disappointed :( you can tell the food is good quality which is why I am not giving a 2 star review. But $11 for a breakfast sandwich and iced coffee is insane to me and I used to live in NYC, so my thoughts on food pricing tends to me fair!! On my last visit I was told they did not have the breakfast meat I wanted even though it's on the menu. The man making my sandwich was not wearing gloves which really just grossed me out. My $8 sandwich was ok, but not enough to fool me into going here again, at least for a long time. :(

T0Sbx9WEi5OuuR7FyixfXw.text: They never have any ingredients for any of their menu items.  I got a cob and had no bacon no blue cheese. They had no ingredients to make a Reuben. And gave me a nova lox sandwich with Vidalia onions! I come hear relatively often because it's the only breakfast place without a line and this happens constantly

Noj9x9IxmKQnwfg5xMp8OQ.text: Ridiculously slow service, inefficiently run and very unprofessional staff. Took me about ten minutes of being first in line to have my order taken and another 10 minutes to get a single hummus and spinach sandwich. The hummus was all over the paper and barely on the bagel itself, the spinach was also not getting "sandwiched" by the bagels at all. Add insult to injury the paper wasn't nearly cut enough so the whole "sandwich" fell apart trying to tear the wrapping. I would have been so much better off at Dunkin' Donuts down the street.

7pgdfq3YCucMazQsGrzqNg.text: definitely would not come back. There were more people working than there were customers and it still took at least 30 minutes to make 4 bagels and they lost half of our order in the process. The people working there seem to lack any sense of urgency or decent customer service skills. On top of that, my bagel with cream cheese had almost no cream cheese? Very odd vibe.

egbxT5c6MASL6i33NWNwZA.text: Three of us had run to Commonplace Coffee a few weekends ago for one of their delicious beverages, and my sister-in-law was feeling a bit peckish. We ran into Bagel Factory for a quick breakfast. I have never been in a restaurant that was so dismal and dingy. Even with the morning light, it was very dark inside, and I was shocked to see the condition of the tables and chairs and walls. I was hoping that the food would compensate for the interior's shortcomings, but I personally think that Panera or Bruegger's serve much better bagels. My sister-in-law's bagel was very small and thin, and I could tell her face fell a bit when it was handed to her. Thankfully, I ordered an egg and cheese bagel, which was a little more satisfying but still nothing special.

V6jq8GJeK_5PfwOL_c3nLw.text: While the bagels are fairly good, the restaurant itself is fairly dirty and unorganized. I didn't see a clean table in the building and they don't appear to have air conditioning, so don't go on a hot day. Unless I was picking up bagels, I wouldn't return.

D5SxwLfsq6H4qFKjZpd3ZA.text: Ordered my food to a very unfriendly employee. I got two bagels with butter and I was one of four customers in the entire store. I'm now typing this as I've waited almost 15 minutes and my bagel still has yet to be prepared. Not impressed

PeBFfFd7HkJNMHGyLpjnOA.text: First time to this location, although I've been to the Oakland location many times out of convenience. I am not a fan of that one, and this one wasn't my first choice on this day. However, my wife sent me on a bacon egg and cheese errand at 630 AM so I figured I'd give the squirrel hill location a shot. I was pleased.  This is first off a totally different experience than the Oakland spot. Feels way less chainy. More attention to detail.  I came in with a mildly persnickety order and it was perfectly executed, by a lady that looked like she knew the deal in this business. She even cut our breakfast sandwiches in half and individually wrapped the halves.  Food was tasty. Coffee was good. Space is surprisingly big with a lot of food options. I'll definitely go back.   One criticism, upgrade those bathrooms pronto.

-gUxE4SwRRLNS6hAgMHgIA.text: Didn't expect for a bagel shop to be cooking great comfort food. This was probably the best french toast I had in a long time. It had a great fluffy texture while not compromising the integrity of the bread. I would most def come back just for this again.

Cp2vCxvPSxozSXkeYgvPeg.text: I would never recommend this dining establishment unless you have an extra hour to spare and don't mind standing around for no reason. My husband and I waited At the counter for over 10 minutes, finally asked if someone could please take our order and were told no they wouldn't take our order and let us sit until they had served everyone who was already seated. This system is ridiculous and we ended up leaving with nothing!!!!

25S56eqU2dJSJWBWtu0aGw.text: My first visit to the Bagel Factory was a little overwhelming. It's a large space with different stations spread out around the perimeter. There's an ice cream and milkshake station to the left with the sandwich counter, cold deli case, and coffee bar around the right side and back. The menu is expansive, which is both great and a lot to consider. I got a garlic bagel lox sandwich with cream cheese, lox, tomato, onions and capers. It was big, delicious, and filling. My breath will be intense for hours, but worth it.   The staff are eager to help and take your order, but this may seem a little brusque if you're trying to decide on one of their many options. The staff were eager to make sure we were comfortable and got everything we needed though. We'll definitely be back, but I think I'm going to look at the menu online beforehand to get some ideas.

xoAW_9LZS8LGwwcL0UKzFQ.text: The order was originally disastrous. But the owner of the establishment fixed the order himself and threw in muffins for the trouble... Amazing customer service from the owner...

ezQg-H0omgQoMuL1OTB7bA.text: Best bagels, morning sandwiches and lunch sandwiches ever. And not hungry for dinner these sandwiches hit the spot. Oh yes I loved the challah French toast. Worth the drive. Yes they do get busy so review writers should have more patience when enjoying time out. It should not be a rush.. rushy people should go to the grocery store.

YToi3YomJNw8VKDSFzHjjA.text: The ex-New-Yorker in me woke one morning craving a bagel, so I decided to try this place out. I got a multi-grain bagel toasted with cream cheese  The good: the bagel itself was good! It had a nice soft texture with a crispy exterior. All the staff were friendly, and my order was ready within a few minutes  The bad: This place is huge and dimly lit, making it feel very empty and unwelcoming. Also, the bagel was a little on the pricey side: at $3.20 I would have expected it to be pretty filling, but I could definitely have eaten a second one.  This is a good spot to pick up some bagels, but until they improve the lighting and break out some squishy chairs, I will always get my food to-go. I would also skip their toasting/cream cheese, and do it yourself at home

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Why the empty display cases?
Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Multi-grain bagel with cream cheese; good, but not filling enough for price

L6vrXJrwzs0H_bVm6HDuhQ.text: Great Hot lean Corn beef. My wife had the pastrami. Large sandwich and great taste. 9.99 for sandwiches I would have Payed $20 it was that good. We will be back soon.  Love it and great service.

Hc7GzFA67KaNfCtNjZ2pJA.text: Good bagels, expansive menu, reasonably priced! Great location. Enjoyed the stop here when visiting Pittsburgh.

XqX8EawbRf-SSm1sk33KRg.text: Raining day, ordered a "Pitt burger " at the bagel factory, not many customers there, I waited for about 17 mins for my burgers, it was an opened beef burger wirh beckons and tomato and lectures, pretty standard taste

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ObLWQFEdIAEjLp206birfg.text: I really wanted to like this place. I liked it when I first walked in. I ordered and went to pay. A nice lady ring me up, took my cash and when right back to packing cookies with her hands. It bothered me that she didn't wash her hands or wear a glove. I was the only person in here and while I waited over 10 mins for a toasted bagel with cream cheese. I was looking in the case where they have all the tuna salads, cream cheese, etc. I noticed that it was very, disgustingly dirty. I'm in food service and I was highly grossed out.   That being said the everything bagel was delicious but I will probably not be back until they actually clean a bit. It just makes me wonder if this is what the front of the store looks like, how does the back of the store look?

SLhDgkJpLKiyjDWVa_Yl1Q.text: I truly enjoy their bagels.  My boyfriend and I stop in here super early on the weekends - before the parking meters start! - so parking isn't too much of an issue then.  We like the ability to sit inside or take with us to go.  I bring a lot of my family and friends who aren't from Pittsburgh here, I think the bagels are that good.  Sometimes the service is slow, but for the taste, I'll take it! :)

WY7t_WXgy_MJnA8n70RiCw.text: Everything people have said is True: kinda dingy, waited forever with only six other customers and not too motivated workers. It's not cheap, so you expect really good. It's not. (Well at least the experience.) My sandwich was not right, so I asked to talk to manager. After 11 minutes, a man came out. He never introduced himself but in conversation said he was the owner. By now I was frustrated and accepted the offer to get my money back. It was funny how he grabbed the sandwich, chip bag and drink and ran to discard them all.  The owner apologized, but no one else did. When I pointed that out, he had a worker insincerely yell "I'm sorry. Have a nice day," as I walked out. Crossing this place off my list.

prRFQEIQVUoaQWOnZHpwSQ.text: Bagels very good. Had the veggie and cinnamon bagel. Would def order again. Coffee was hot and fresh squeezed orange juice delicious. Delivery right on time.

r5neejJabA7my8GsIGyQrw.text: On Sunday morning, I got a takeout order of a bakers dozen of bagels. There were lots of options to choose from and relatively quick service.  Also got a container of cream cheese.  Bagels were decent quality and the store seemed cute in a down-to-earth sort of way.

A6yEv3P1zrv89FHGkhbmDA.text: Don't bother ordering via GRUBHUB here on yelp. Waited two hours for my food before having my order cancelled. Won't be ordering again.

07KOpkv13SYfkEEh8wRxEQ.text: I do not recommend this place at all. I bought an egg and cheese bagel and it was horrible. I believe the egg was 2 or 3 days old and they heated it in the microwave before serving it, when I opened up the bagel it looked and felt like silicone. Not mentioning the cheese. Disgusting.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Lpy7LHKR3-SYwBPoF4u_-w.text: I tried Bagel Factory for the first time via UberEats. I ordered a half dozen bagels and was immediately called by a woman named Karen alerting me that every Tuesday(that day was a Tuesday) is buy a bagel get a bagel free day.  She didn't have to do that because I would have never known anyway. Now I'll be a frequent customer! Also, the bagels are delicious!!

-kUQAkiLrTKRDfp4XU4c7Q.text: Ate there a few weeks ago. Service was poor. Everybody seemed annoyed to be working there. There were four people working and two customers, and they really struggled to do basic things like relay the coffee offer to the coffee person and the short-order request to the kitchen. The bagels were fine but nothing special. It was 11 am on a Friday and they were out of smoked salmon, which is a level of bagel-incompetence that I've never before witnessed. The interior is dingy; seating is disorganized and arranged weirdly, with divisions and fences in random places. If a person came in, got six bagels to go, and left, it might rank 3 stars. But for *literally* anything else, including a simple sit-down order like coffee, two eggs, and a bagel, it's poor. Skip it.

wjGcxbeZMwBuwp5tcMnkrA.text: Weird place. OK breakfast sandwiches and OK coffee. Friendly staff. Expected a little more.

Kc1Rv50VAuSWDK9eb8x0Lg.text: If I could give this no stars, I would give it no stars. The multi grain bagel tasted like a stale white plain bagel. The eggs were pre-made fried eggs, and the sandwich was absolutely gross. The other sandwich we had which was hummus and arugula on wheat bread had la scant teaspoon of hummus on wheat bread that didn't look like wheat bread. Also when I ordered iced coffee I had to wait for them to get me the milk because they don't have regular milk on the counter with the skim and the half-and-half.  Last but not least there was no air conditioning. I was told by the staff that the air conditioning broke and then another customer came in and told me that there was no air conditioning here all summer last summer. Terrible place.

47xjhQHBMMilH3M-T6ZwPw.text: This place is almost always closed and there's no hours posted so i genuinely don't know when they're open. They happened to be today, and i was craving a tuna melt, so i took a chance (even though I'm disappointed about 80% of the time i go there or to the Oakland location). I ordered a tuna melt ("do you want that toasted?") and potato latkes to go, and then waited for 15 minutes for my food even though the place was completely empty and i think there were 3 staff members there. When they brought my food out the staff member asked me if I'd wanted latkes, and told me he hadn't made them or charged me for them. I said no and left, noticing how small the bag was. When i checked out my food i saw this $9 tuna melt was the size of a standard sandwich you'd make with grocery store sliced bread, and was literally just cheddar on tuna salad. I didn't specify that i wanted stuff on it (lettuce, tomatoes, mayo) so okay I guess that's on me. I hopped on the bus to go eat my lunch in a nice shady spot in Oakland, and quickly noticed that the bag was leaking some mysterious green juice that got onto my clothes and backpack.  In the end i have only myself to blame-- i know better than to mess with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagel Factory - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mysterious green juice

tpGu_2ZwOX4ClIbt2mYJFQ.text: The thing I love most about the Bagel Factory isn't even their bagels: it's their breakfast entrees. I love their smoked salmon scramble with a side of potatoes, but they have a pretty good selection of other wonderful choices as well. The only thing I've ordered that I didn't like were the pancakes.   Their French toast bagel is one of the best sweet bagels I've had. Sometimes I eat the French toast bagels cold and plain, but they are wonderful just toasted with butter.  The shop is also really cute and has a nice vibe. The people who work there are quick and also very friendly. This places feels weirdly unique and homey and should be visited when in Squirrel Hill.

raJkWPPooxQU-TQdZiZVeg.text: Great matzo ball soup! This place is very filling. All of their bread is delicious here. Obviously they're all about bagels, and their bacon, egg and cheese is typically my favorite. It's a greasy bagel because they make that bacon sizzle so you've been warned if greasy isn't your thing. When it comes to cream cheese, many places that serve bagels only give you a small portion barely enough to spread but not here! They lather it on so thick you have to eat it slice by slice rather than as a bagel sandwich. Some of my friends think it's too much and they like to take some off or just order it with less but I love cream cheese goodness on every bite. Each order is made as you like it so if you don't want it to be cream cheese with a side of bagel like me then simply tell them to go light on the cream cheese. This place aims to serve and they do it well.

JblSkoQSxnp_PTB5wz2r_w.text: Went here with my boyfriend today, we shared a lox everything bagel and whitefish garlic bagel. We got both toasted and they were quite delicious (the whitefish was particularly tasty).  All the employees were friendly and helpful too! Had to take off 1 star because their "homemade" juices are really sweet and certainly not homemade--we got cranberry and orange and neither one was good. We'd go back for bagels next time we're in Pittsburgh :-)

h4VlajOaKJbkzwY6y78pfg.text: Fantastic nova lox bagel! Certainly carb breakfast of choice- nova lox sandwich on a toasted everything bagel. Sometimes bagel comes out a little burnt, and sometimes the staff taking the order can be a little short and flustered. The food keeps us coming back again!

ZwjmX6dlGg_7khHpJRc0VQ.text: The food is always really tasty -- I love the bagels, they do coffee just right, and dude, they spaceshare with Ben and Jerry's.  The problem is with the service -- they take forever.  Really forever.  It's not a place to pop in on the way to school or anywhere else because you'll be late.

-qETIW5U0mCYG5MIZJu8aQ.text: I'm an out-of-towner, but when I'm in Squirrel Hill, I always make sure to stop here for a egg sandwich and a few bagels to go. The super cinnamon and the whole wheat are particularly lovely.

zuF8rY-PiYYtINdU67pyRQ.text: We have enjoyed this deli in the past and while the breakfasts look delicious, we will not be returning.  Whether our food quality was determined by having the Living Social coupon or not, our corn beef was LESS than fresh on the Ruben.   Usually, we will speak up as it is better for business, but for some reason we didn't mention the disappointment to the restaurant staff.  Writing a Yelp review is far more powerful and hopefully prevents what happened to us happening to someone else.  Was this the negligence  of the kitchen help? Was this policy for coupon holders?  We don't know and never will.  Who ever or whomever is responsible for the old corn beef on January 21, 2012 should know that this cost you good customers and now many countless others after this review posts.  Disappointed and feeling taken advantage of,  Cathy in Munhall

LbK11OcqSQWh5Hd4f6a_UA.text: We went to the Bagel Factory when we found a Groupon for it, and after reading that it served the best bagels in Pittsburgh. We got a dozen bagels, two breakfast sandwiches, and two espresso drinks.  The employee who took our bagel was very quiet, and didn't really greet us at all. The barista who rung out our order and made our drinks was rude to us, asking "what do you want?".  On the brighter side of things, the bagels were good, as were the sandwiches and the drinks. I just wish the employees had been a little more friendly to us. I'd return for the bagels, but definitely not for the service.

gRzCzvVebG66k5JmusWO5w.text: I absolutely love the bagels and cream cheese here, best bagels I have had... to the point where I miss this place when I get bagels out of town. Every time I stray from the simple bagel I seem to be a bit disappointed, but the bagels themselves are worth the 4 star review.

aAmKIb4KsBZZ3a8OvpxaDw.text: We had lunch there on 7/29/12  Before going inside the tables outside had dirty plates on them. When we went to order the person behind counter says the grill was closed the grill person did not come in. We ordered sandwiches. What sandwich the salami had so little on it , 3 very thin slices and very little cream cheese on the other bagel. Actually, what cream chesse? The workers there said that IS WHAT  the OWNER WANTS.The bathrooms , kitchen and the eating area was also very dirty.  Where is the health department. The manager needs help on running a businnes It could be a really good place

Lqjw5YPbiHRSYnDN6Lnggw.text: This place can be hit or miss.  I like their bagels, and the food I've gotten has always been tasty (except for the corned beef hash).  Usually service is friendly, but it is slow, slow, slow.  If you're in a hurry at all, skip Bagel Factory.  There's also a Ben & Jerry's inside, but I've never tried it.

BXPhse1EbgS71HB4h0KbMg.text: the bagel factory is great! we frequented here many saturday & sunday mornings for brunch. in the nice weather, you can eat outside on forbes ave.   they have great bagels (not NY, but hey, still the best you can get for 8 hours away). they have hands-down the BEST challah french toast. we used to try and split it, but there ended up being a lot of fighting over who was getting more of their share, so now we each get an order. service can be a bit slow when they are busy during brunch hours, but i like a lazy brunch so i don't mind.

m4aGRc0TyvubitLsEQOruA.text: I'll sacrifice a lot for a great bagel, and here at Bagel Factory you get both great bagels and sacrifices. The slow-as-molasses service and often-dirty tables: no biggie, since the bagel I get here comes covered in lox spread and is chewy and boiled to True bagel perfection. So far, once of the best bagels I've had in the 'burgh.

lIfNLvAS399BOwiL0GSh-A.text: The bagels are so-so, which is not a great thing if you're called "The Bagel Factory." The atmosphere is nice and so are the people.

GypO3kj9YHrM2C96tkzR_Q.text: I wouldn't consider myself a bagel connoisseur although I've been eating them for more than 15 years in the tri-state area. Nothing really stood out, but at the same time I was happy with my sesame bagel breakfast sandwich. I wish it were a little less greasy though.

3mBnuEBKew2hjDER8MkYEg.text: Slower than you can possibly imagine, and then slower than that.  Every employee who communicates with customers is weirdly uncommunicative.  I cracked a tooth on a bone in the whitefish salad once.  The bagels are good, though, and the cream cheese is fresh.  I like that there are a zillion flavors of bagel.  I'd eat here only if I could get someone else (maybe someone I didn't really like, or whose time I didn't value?) to pick up my food for me.

1BYMf32yzsf6PtPR6nLWKw.text: Simply put, the bagels here are pretty good.  Some seem strangely disproportionate, as in the egg bagels are big, puffy and round, but the veggie bagels seem thin and with a much larger hole in the middle.  But anyway, generally good.  What surprised me today was an order of egg and cheese on a toasted bagel.   The egg seemed reheated from previously being cooked, possibly in a microwave, and the cheese looked like a badly melted Kraft single.  I was expecting them at least to crack a fresh egg on the grill, and get a little good grease on to the bagel - but no luck... this was a huge disappointment.  Will stick to the bagels only from now on.

gkI5BjAojgpG0DQ9I11R8A.text: Bagel Factory, not.  No hot food after 1pm. What are the owners thinking. It is a Monday!  I was on Shady at a Dr, appointment and thought a hot bowl and hod corned beef sandwich would be a nice treat.  The Bagel waiter was so flat and unconcerned. "Cook's gone".  "Nothing hot  except a toasted bagel" The 75 cents for a half slice of swiss you could read thru made me laugh. How pathetic this place is.   No customer service. No smiles. Oh, the cashier did not want to return my debit card until she had a reciept. I only use my debit card and never had this happen, not even when I travel and pruchase more than a sandwich.  Will NEVER go there again.  Will share this experience on FaceBook.  The ice cream shop was the topper. Expensive to rent comercial space in S.H., but 2 eateries in a room the size of my gameroom.  No wonder it takes 2 incoming source of revenues. Dump. S.H. has really declined since I lived there. Customer Service has, also, my review is a  negative six,  wasnot posted with 1 star..

g8DlMJkhgFQgTT_xJ-BoCw.text: I went into this place on a Sunday early afternoon thinking that I would be able to grab a couple sandwiches for a picnic and be gone. I was mistaken.  I got into a line that wasn't terribly long, but wasn't moving. After about 10 minutes, someone behind me went up to the counter to see why things were taking so long. As he was walking back, he said to his wife that they had stopped taking orders because they were making other people's food.  The seating area was not terribly busy, but the line for take out was going out the door. I had never heard of a business stopping taking orders before, and was not pleased. After another 10 minutes of waiting in line, during which time multiple people walked out, I was able to give my order. I didn't think the prices were outrageous until I ordered my sandwich, a ham sandwich. I was then asked if I wanted anything else on it other than ham. This puzzled me, as I expected a DELI SANDWICH to come with something other than meat. If I had not specifically said I wanted cheese, or lettuce, or anything else for that matter, I would have paid 6 bucks for 2 slices of bread and a bit of ham. I also ordered an egg salad sandwich for my girlfriend, requesting lettuce and tomato and finished my order and paid.   After then waiting an additional 15 minutes, my name was called and my food was ready. I asked the guy preparing the food if the orders were correct, specifically that there was lettuce and tomato on the egg salad sandwich. He replied that there was nothing on the sandwich except egg salad, but that he could add lettuce and tomato with no problem.   So after waiting for almost 40 minutes, I had my food and proceeded to my picnic, where the food was not terribly impressive. The ham sandwich was bland and the egg salad sandwich was very uninspired, as it seemed that the egg salad was all mayo and no egg.  I do not plan on ever returning to this place. This may be shortsighted of me as they may have had a very slow day, but one bad experience is more than enough for me.
